body:
Comment 3: 
I am very sorry, you are correct. I was confused about the signatures for my String
methods. I was also 
confused about the semantics for "%+v" when the field to be formatted has a String
method on it's type. I 
apologize for misleading you into thinking that there was a bug in "print.go".

One of the reasons I nested my Color data structure with values and not pointers was
because I looked at the 
source code to Printf and saw that it will chase nested structures (nice feature) but
not nested pointers 
(makes sense, I saw the comment).

I have two follow-ups to this issue. One will be a request to consider changing the
sematics of "%+v" when 
the field to be formatted has a String method on it's type. I assume I should open a new
issue for that?

The other will be some thoughts on the interactions between String methods, the printing
of nested data 
structures, defining String methods on values vs pointers, and efficiency vs coding
style. I will definely open a 
new issue for that one assuming I even decide to move forward with writing it up.

Thanks and sorry again for the misdirection.
